A ballet film by the Mosfilm studio based on the famous production by Yuri Grigorovich to the music of Aram Khachaturian. The roles are performed by the greatest dancers of our time - Vladimir Vasiliev and Maris Liepa. A. Khachaturian's ballet, which tells the story of the rebellion of gladiators and slaves led by the Thracian Spartacus and his defeat by the troops of the Roman commander Crassus, is based on true events in the history of Rome (1st century BC).

Year of production: 1975

The ballet has four main characters, four soloists. These are the conflicting images of Spartacus and Crassus, personifying the clash of two worlds, as well as Spartacus's beloved Phrygia, and the insidious courtesan Aegina, Crassus's accomplice. They express the main ideas and fundamental provisions of the ballet. Revolutionary choreography by Yuri Grigorovich, as well as the performers of the main male roles Vladimir Vasiliev and Maris Liepa - made this ballet immortal.

youtube-jlp2U3-e-do.title: White Tiger | WAR MOVIE | ENGLISH DUBBING | Directed by Karen Shakhnazarov

sources.description:
Incredible rumors circulate among Soviet soldiers about a mysterious German tank that suddenly appears and disappears on the battlefield, destroying everything in its path. This is the White Tiger, the devil no one can handle. After one of such battles, a badly burnt tank driver is found in a disabled Soviet tank. Surviving such monstrous burns is impossible, but the tank driver is quickly on the mend. Doctors are perplexed and throw up their hands, assuring that it’s a miracle. 

Still, this man does not remember who he is, where he comes from, but he knows one thing - the mystical German tank does exist. He believes that the war has given him back his life to rid the world of the killer tank, the White Tiger. What’s that? A fantasy? A mirage? Third Reich’s secret weapon? Or did he discover the ultimate secret of the war?  

Year of production: 2012

Directed by: Karen Shakhnazarov 
Written by: Aleksandr Borodyansky, Karen Shakhnazarov

youtube-3uFBQqf3r2s.title: El Imperio Desaparecido | DRAMÁTICA | Dirigida por Karen Shakhnazarov

sources.description:
El momento de la acción son los “estancados” años setenta. Los héroes de la película son estudiantes que aún no sospechan que el país donde nacieron pronto desaparecerá del mapa mundial. Mientras tanto, los escolares de ayer estudian sin preocupaciones en el instituto. Los personajes principales son Sergei, Lyuda y su amigo común Stepan. Sergei comienza a cortejar conmovedoramente a la amable y confiada Lyuda, y comienzan un hermoso romance. 

Sin embargo, pronto aparece una nueva chica en el curso: la espectacular Katya. Sergei, aprovechando que Lyuda está enferma, comienza a coquetear con ella. Lyuda se entera de esto y cree que tal comportamiento es una traición. Stepan, secretamente enamorado de Lyudmila, comienza a ayudarla con sus estudios, a mostrar signos de atención y pasan cada vez más tiempo juntos...

Cuarta parte: https://youtu.be/4M33Iy0Kjqo

"Todos los pensamientos que tienen consecuencias enormes son siempre simples. Mi idea es que si las personas viciosas están interconectadas y forman una fuerza, entonces las personas honestas deben hacer lo mismo", con estas palabras de León Tolstoi comienza la película épica "Guerra y paz". 

La película cuenta la vida de la sociedad rusa a principios del siglo XIX. En el contexto de los trágicos y dramáticos acontecimientos asociados con la guerra con Napoleón, se presentan vívidamente las búsquedas psicológicas de Andrei Bolkonsky, Natasha Rostova, Pierre Bezukhov y otros héroes de la famosa novela.

Un drama de guerra dirigido por Nikolai Lebedev. La película está basada en un cuento del mismo nombre de Emmanuil Kazakevich. 

En 1944, se envió un grupo de exploradores del Ejército Rojo detrás de la línea del frente para aclarar la información sobre la formación enemiga. Después de cruzar la línea del frente, los soldados se convencen gradualmente de que el enemigo está reagrupando en secreto sus fuerzas para una contraofensiva decisiva. El comandante explorador decide infiltrarse discretamente en un cruce ferroviario, donde se encuentra el centro de mando...

Action series about special operation to eliminate the terrorist Shamil Basayev. The film is based on actual events and touches on one of the most horrific pages of the recent past of the Russian Federation. As a result of a highly complex operation of the special services, terrorist leader Shamil Basayev was killed. It was him who became the prototype of the main negative character in the movie, Shamil Bazgayev. 

Shamil Basayev is responsible for heinous acts of terrorism: 
- The Budennovsk attack (1995)
- The kidnapping of Doctors Without Borders worker in Chechnya (2001) 
- Nord-Ost siege (2002)
- Suicide bombing of the Chechen government headquarters (2002)
- Series of suicide bombings (2003)
- Bombing of gas pipelines and power transmission lines in the Moscow region (2004)
- Terrorist attack in Grozny on May 9, 2004
- Terrorist attacks in Moscow (2004)
- Airplane Explosions (2004)
- The Beslan school siege (2004)
- Power system breakdown in Moscow
- Arson at the Stanislavsky and Nemirovich-Danchenko Theater (2005)

The script of Decision: Liquidation was based on the memories of the direct participants of the FSB operation.

youtube-p13kRKXNNEs.title: Twenty six days in the life of Dostoevsky

sources.description:
October 1866. Dostoevsky is in a terrible situation: if he does not hand over his new novel, The Gambler, to Stellovsky within a month, the latter will receive the right to publish the writer's works for free for nine years. In order to speed up the work process, Fyodor Mikhailovich invites a stenographer, the young Anna Snitkina. Anna Grigoryevna becomes not only the first assistant, but also the wife of the genius of Russian literature. Scenes from the novel The Gambler are introduced into the plot of the film.

Year of Production: 1980

Director: Zarkhi Alexander
Scriptwriters: Finn Pavel, Vladimirov Vladimir
Composer: Gabeli Irakli
Camera operator: Klimov Vladimir
Production designer: Kusakova Lyudmila

Cast: Anatoly Solonitsyn, Yuri Katin-Yartsev, Evgenia Simonova, Evgeniy Dvorzhetsky, Nikolai Denisov, Ewa Shikulska

youtube-nPQrqcxaTLk.title: Anna Karenina. Chuyện kể của Vronsky

sources.description:
1904 Chiến tranh Nga-Nhật. Mãn Châu. Bệnh viện quân đội Nga, đang rút lui, chiếm một ngôi làng Trung Quốc gần như bị bỏ hoang. Giám đốc bệnh viện, Sergei Karenin, biết rằng viên sĩ quan bị thương mà ông đang phẫu thuật, Bá tước Vronsky, chính là kẻ đã giết mẹ ông, Anna Karenina, và gián tiếp gây ra cái chết của cha ông. Không ảo tưởng và không mong đợi câu trả lời, Karenin vẫn đến gặp Vronsky và hỏi câu hỏi đã dằn vặt anh cả đời: điều gì đã khiến mẹ anh vượt qua ranh giới? Đến lượt mình, Bá tước Vronsky biết rằng bác sĩ chính là Seryozha Karenin. Sau một lúc do dự, bá tước đồng ý kể câu chuyện về mối tình bi thảm của mình với Anna Karenina, lưu ý rằng mọi người chỉ nhớ những gì thuận tiện để họ nhớ...

Năm phát hành: 2017

youtube-TiGbLBU-HUc.title: Stalingrado, primera parte | PELÍCULA BÉLICA | Subtitulos en Español

sources.description:
Segunda parte: https://youtu.be/_H-f5sWr45s

1942 Toda Europa central está bajo el control de los alemanes. Un miembro de la organización antifascista clandestina, Harro Schulze-Boysen, se entera de la operación militar secreta "Blau", que brinda a los alemanes la oportunidad de capturar el Cáucaso. Schulze-Boysen informó de todo a Moscú, pero Stalin consideró que esta información era desinformación. El plan alemán de crear una ofensiva de imitación cerca de Moscú para mantener a los rusos allí funcionó. Ahora, decidieron en Berlín, tenían garantizado un rápido éxito en dirección suroeste. 

Además, la contraofensiva rusa cerca de Jarkov fracasó: algunas de nuestras tropas fueron rodeadas y otras se retiraron a Stalingrado. Stalingrado adquirió una importancia estratégica especial para las partes en conflicto. Para los alemanes, era un camino abierto hacia el sur, hacia el Cáucaso y la India, como soñaba Hitler. Así comenzaron los 200 días y noches de Stalingrado, terribles y sangrientos.

Año de producción: 1989

Director: Ozerov Yuri
Guionista: Ozerov Yuri
Compositor: Levitin Yuri
Operadores: Slabnevich Igor, Gusev Vladimir
Diseñadores de producción: Yasyukevich Felix, Kirs Vladimir

A historical and biographical picture about the great Russian naval commander Fyodor Ushakov. 

The events of the film take place in 1785-1791 during the war with Turkey. Prince Potemkin, the favorite of Catherine II, entrusts the young Ushakov with the construction of ships. The Black Sea Fleet is created in the shortest possible time, despite the plague epidemic and fires, and Ushakov becomes a national hero. However, court intriguers manage to turn the empress against him with lies and denunciations.

youtube-cYUlJ4eHxcc.title: Libertad, Dulce Palabra | DRAMÁTICA | Con subtítulos en español

sources.description:
En uno de los países latinoamericanos, los parlamentarios fueron arrestados ilegalmente a principios de los años 70. Son arrojados a la inexpugnable fortaleza militar de San Stefano, donde están condenados a permanecer muchos años sin juicio. Por instrucciones del partido, Francisco Pancho y su esposa María preparan la liberación de sus dirigentes. Están abriendo un bar justo enfrente de la fortaleza. Los oficiales y soldados de San Stefano se convierten en sus invitados privados, por lo que los propietarios del establecimiento están siempre al tanto de las novedades penitenciarias. Desde el garaje del bar se empieza a cavar el túnel subterráneo hasta la celda de los presos...

youtube-JLh__8NaU1k.title: El Día de Plenilunio | DRAMÁTICA | Con subtítulos en español

sources.description:
La película trata sobre la interconexión de acontecimientos que, a primera vista, no significan nada, pero que en realidad tienen un impacto en la vida de completos desconocidos. El espectador se sumerge en el flujo de viajes en el espacio y el tiempo. No hay un único personaje principal ni un único esquema narrativo, no hay una trama en el sentido habitual de la palabra. Esta película es un reflejo de la vida, donde los destinos de las personas se cruzan de manera extraña, creando en la pantalla la imagen de la Rusia de finales de los 90. Cada personaje lleva su propia historia, su propio secreto sin resolver, como un transeúnte en la calle a quien notas e inmediatamente lo pierdes de vista para siempre.

Año de producción: 1998

Film adaptation based on the story by F. Dostoevsky. Petersburg in the 40s of the 19th century. Summer, white nights. On the banks of the Neva, the Dreamer meets Nastenka. For five nights, walking around the city, young people talk about themselves. Having lost faith in the feelings of the man she loves, Nastenka promises the Dreamer who is in love with her to marry him, but... the other one appears, Nastenka is happy again, and the Dreamer is lonely again. Now his loneliness is more sorrowful, since he has realized how rich life is, and how fruitless the dreams in which his days pass.

youtube-c-xwm-thVYU.title: Andrei Rubliev | DRAMÁTICA | Con subtítulos en español

sources.description:
La imagen muestra un amplio panorama de la vida en Rusia a principios del siglo XV, cuando vivía y trabajaba el genio artista ruso Andrei Rubliev. Sus creaciones mostraron al mundo un milagro de armonía, belleza, luz, esperanza, y todo esto en un momento en que el país está destrozado por luchas civiles principescas y las incursiones tártaras, el hambre y la pestilencia persiguen a la gente. La película está dividida en ocho cuentos, que tienen poca conexión argumental entre sí, pero que dibujan una imagen general de la Rusia medieval, que va tomando forma como un mosaico.
La película fue incluida entre las 100 mejores películas de la historia del cine, según una encuesta realizada a críticos de cine de todo el mundo en 1978.

Screen adaptation of the novel by V. Kozhevnikov. Four films tell about the exploits of Soviet intelligence officers during the Second World War. The plot centers on the image of the brave intelligence officer Alexander Belov, who works in the Third Reich under the name Johann Weiss. He neutralizes sabotage groups thrown into our territory. And after being transferred to the SS, Belov has the opportunity to preempt the start of major military operations...

sources.description:

Basado en la novela de I. Goncharov "Oblomov". Ilya Ilyich Oblomov, el propietario de una pequeña finca, pasa todo su tiempo en la ociosidad, entregándose al sueño o a la ociosidad. Su único amigo cercano, Andrei Ivanovich Stoltz, está tratando de cambiar su estilo de vida. Sin embargo, Oblomov toma una cosa y luego otra y, sin llevar nada hasta el final, siempre se desilusiona. El fenómeno, que recibió del autor el nombre de oblomovshchina, salió de las páginas de la novela mucho más allá de su tiempo...

Based on the novel of the same name by K. Simonov. A touching, full of aching sadness, love story of the commander of the aviation regiment Polynin and the frontline actress Galina Prokofieva. He heard her songs and his life changed forever.…

Civil war, southern steppes of Russia. Circumstances bring together different people: security officer Zavragin, professor Shelako, famous artist Orlinsky, nurse Katya and White Guard officer Beklemishev. They make their way through the white cordons into the city occupied by the Red Army. Beklemishev needs to get into the city in order to, with the help of a group of conspirators, raise a rebellion against Soviet power...

La misión Solaris ha establecido una base en un planeta que parece albergar algún tipo de inteligencia, pero los detalles son confusos y muy secretos. Después de la misteriosa desaparición de uno de los tres científicos de la base, el personaje principal es enviado para reemplazarlo. Encuentra la estación en ruinas y a los dos científicos restantes fríos y reservados. Cuando también se encuentra con su esposa, que ha estado muerta durante diez años, comienza a apreciar la naturaleza desconcertante de la inteligencia alienígena...

Calificación IMDb: 8,0

Inicio: Elenco: Grinko Nikolai, Dvorzhetsky Vladislav, Banionis Donatas, Solonitsyn Anatoly, Bondarchuk Natalia, Yarvet Yuri, Sargsyan Sos

Finales de los años 80 en la URSS. Iván Miroshnikov, graduado de la escuela de Moscú, no aprueba los exámenes de ingreso a la universidad y comienza a trabajar como mensajero en la redacción de la revista Question of Cognition. Ivan conoce a Katya, la hija del profesor Kuznetsov. Los jóvenes pertenecen a diferentes estratos sociales, pero a pesar de las diferencias en educación, nivel de vida, hábitos y objetivos, ambos siempre tienen al menos una cosa en común: el deseo de expresarse. Una comedia existencial sincera y algo triste sobre un héroe de la perestroika sigue siendo hasta el día de hoy una de las películas más populares en Rusia.

The film's script is based on A.P. Chekhov's story "Ward No. 6", but the film's action has been moved to the present time. Another innovation of the creators of the film is that the narration is conducted in the form of interviews with people, in a documentary manner. 

Evgeny Khobotov is the new head physician of a psychiatric hospital. He introduces us to Ivan Gromov, who has a persecution mania. It turns out that the previous chief physician, Dr. Ragin, considered him... a prophet. Now Ragin is in this hospital as a patient. But how did it happen that a healthy person, after communicating with a mentally ill person, loses his mind? How did he cross this line? And in general, isn’t the line between mentally ill people and normal people illusory? Perhaps it would be true to say that you and I all suffer from different forms of mental illness? One way or another, Dr. Ragin’s colleagues and relatives are trying to understand why the visit to ward No. 6 was fatal for the physician.

sources.description:
Una comedia absurda de Karen Shakhnazarov.

El ingeniero Varakin llega desde Moscú a una pequeña ciudad por negocios. Necesita descubrir por qué la fábrica local dejó de suministrar repuestos. Sin embargo, lo primero que ve en la fábrica es a una secretaria completamente desnuda en la recepción del director. Pero nadie más parece desconcertado por esta embarazosa circunstancia. Cada día el ingeniero se enfrenta a situaciones cada vez más extrañas. Además de todo eso, Varakin descubre que no puede salir de la ciudad.

Año de producción: 1988

Dirigida por: Karen Shakhnazarov
Escrito por: Alexander Borodyansky, Karen Shakhnazarov
Director de fotografía: Nikolai Nemolyaev

youtube-HZIY_JvJVRA.title: L' Assassin du Tsar | DRAME MYSTIQUE

sources.description:
L'histoire parle d'un psychiatre Smirnov venu remplacer le médecin-chef sortant d'un hôpital psychiatrique local. Son attention a été attirée sur Timofeev, un patient de longue date de la clinique, un ancien détenu souffrant d'une personnalité alternée. Durant les périodes d'exacerbation de cette maladie, le patient se considère comme l'assassin d'Alexandre II et de Nicolas II, empereurs de Russie. Le docteur Smirnov s'intéresse à ce cas unique et commence à étudier activement ce patient inhabituel. Le prédécesseur de Smirnov pensait qu’«il y a des choses dans l’esprit humain qu’il vaut mieux ne jamais toucher», mais le nouveau médecin préconise un traitement différent.

Comment les conversations avec le patient et la révélation des circonstances de l'exécution historique affecteront-elles le médecin? Et où mènera finalement une telle thérapie de choc?

Participant à la Compétition Principale du Festival de Cannes (1991). Un drame psychologique avec des éléments mystiques.

L'un des rares films contemporains sur la révolution russe, la fin tragique de la dynastie des Romanov, le dernier empereur russe et l'exécution de la famille royale.

Année de production : 1991

Réalisé par : Karen Shakhnazarov
Scénario : Alexandre Borodianski, Karen Shakhnazarov
Directeur de la photographie : Nikolay Nemolyaev
Musique : Vladislav Shut
Décoratrice : Lyudmila Kusakova
Avec : Malcolm McDowell, Oleg Yankovsky, Armen Dzhigarkhanyan

Une comédie absurde de Karen Shakhnazarov.

L'ingénieur Varakin vient de Moscou dans une petite ville pour affaires. Il doit découvrir pourquoi l'usine locale a cessé de fournir des pièces de rechange. Cependant, la première chose qu’il voit à l’usine est une secrétaire complètement nue à la réception du directeur. Mais personne d’autre ne semble déconcerté par cette circonstance embarrassante. Chaque jour, l’ingénieur est confronté à des situations de plus en plus bizarres. En plus de tout cela, Varakin découvre qu'il ne peut pas quitter la ville.

Année de production : 1988

Réalisé par : Karen Shakhnazarov
Scénario : Alexandre Borodiansky, Karen Shakhnazarov
Directeur de la photographie : Nikolai Nemolyaev
Décoratrice : Lyudmila Kusakova
Musique : Edouard Artemyev
Avec : Leonid Filatov, Oleg Basilashvili, Eugène Evstigneev, Vladimir Menshov, Piotr Scherbakov, Armen Djigarkhanyan, Alexey Zharkov

The film is about the interconnection of events that, at first glance, mean nothing, but in fact have an impact on the lives of complete strangers. The viewer is immersed in the flow of travel in space and time. There is no one main character or a single narrative outline, there is no plot in the usual sense of the word. This film is a reflection of life, where people’s destinies intersect in a bizarre way, creating on the screen the image of Russia in the late 90s. Each character carries his own story, his own unsolved secret - like a passerby on the street whom you noticed and immediately lost from sight forever.

يمثل فيلم "مرآة" انعكاسات وأفكار الشخص المسمى هنا المؤلف. لا يظهر بشكل شخصي ، فقط صوته المرهق. وعلى الشاشة ، كما لو كانت في المرآة ، صور من ماضيه. في البداية ، تبدو الذكريات مبعثرة: حب الأم ، الذي لا يعرف المؤلف كيف يعبر عنه ، شعور ثاقب للأب ، عدم الرضا عن نفسه بسبب العلاقة غير المتطورة مع ابنه ... تدريجياً يتضح - هذا هو حساب الشخص عن نفسه ، حكم صعب للضمير ، ربما حتى جملة. يحتل الفيلم مكانة خاصة في أعمال أندريه تاركوفسكي. في ذلك ، التقط والدته المسنة ماريا إيفانوفنا فيشنياكوفا تاركوفسكي ، خلف الكواليس صوت والده ، الشاعر أرسيني تاركوفسكي ، وهو يقرأ أصوات قصائده الرائعة. إنه فيلم اعتراف ، فيلم وحي ...

Based on the play by K. Simonov

USA, 1946. The editor-in-chief of an influential newspaper, McPherson, commissions the talented journalist Harry Smith to write a critical book about Russia for a substantial fee. Smith's fiancee Jessie persuades him to take on this job for the sake of the family's future. Using the advance, Smith and Jesse buy a house, furnishings, a car in installments... The hero is trying to come up with something a compromise. However, McPherson tightens his demands: “there should be no middle ground in the Russian question.” Then Smith decides to write an honest book about the country he fell in love with. This turns into a drama for him: he loses his job, his property, his beloved woman leaves him... But Smith does not give up and continues to fight for the truth.

Musical comedy. 1913 Russia celebrates the 300th anniversary of the Romanov dynasty. The steamship "St. Nicholas" sails along the Volga to Nizhny Novgorod - the center of the holiday. On board there is a respectable audience: businessmen, industrialists, princes... Everyone is having fun. The rich merchant Frol Satanovsky plays poker with other merchants, not suspecting that seasoned card sharpers are sitting at the same table with him, and the game is a well-performed performance. The adventurous search for the main swindler begins!

In the past, Filimonov was a talented, promising musician. The present is prosaic - he is the son-in-law of a “big man”, and nothing more. Once Filimonov had a heart attack - and this at less than forty years old! This unpleasant incident was the reason for meeting the wonderful nurse Lida. And a whirlwind romance began... But finding the courage and strength to radically change your established life is always difficult.

youtube-kRPx8RFpp1s.title: White Tiger | WAR MOVIE | with French subtitles

sources.description:
La seconde Guerre mondiale. Il y a des rumeurs incroyables parmi les soldats soviétiques au sujet d'un mystérieux char allemand qui apparaît de nulle part sur le champ de bataille et disparaît également nulle part, détruisant tout sur son passage. 

Il s'agit du «Tigre Blanc », le diable lui-même, qui est trop coriace pour tout un bataillon de chars. Un jour, un soldat grièvement brûlé est retrouvé dans un char soviétique endommagé. Il est impossible de survivre avec des brûlures aussi monstrueuses, mais le pétrolier se remet rapidement. Les médecins haussent les épaules avec perplexité – c’est un miracle, rien d’autre. Cet homme ne se souvient pas de qui il est ni d'où il vient, mais il sait une chose : le char mystique allemand existe réellement. 

Pour combattre le Tigre Blanc, le commandement soviétique décide de créer un modèle spécial basé sur le T-34-85. Maintenant, nous devons tout faire pour détruire le Tigre Blanc.

Année de production : 2012

Réalisateur : Chakhnazarov Karen
Scénaristes : Alexandre Borodianski, Karen Shakhnazarov

Part Two: https://youtu.be/VB8NDI0oVBQ

1942 All of central Europe is under the heel of the Germans. A member of the underground anti-fascist organization, Harro Schulze-Boysen, learns about the secret military operation "Blau", which gives the Germans the opportunity to capture the Caucasus. Schulze-Boysen reported everything to Moscow, but Stalin considered this disinformation. The German plan - to create an imitation offensive near Moscow in order to keep the Russians there - worked. Now, they decided in Berlin, they were guaranteed quick success in the southwestern direction.

Moreover, the Russian counteroffensive near Kharkov floundered - some of our troops were surrounded, some retreated to Stalingrad. Stalingrad acquired special strategic importance for the warring parties. For the Germans, it was an open road to the south, to the Caucasus and India, as Hitler dreamed. Thus began the 200 days and nights of Stalingrad, terrible and bloody.

Year of production: 1989

Director: Ozerov Yuri
Screenwriter: Ozerov Yuri
Composer: Levitin Yuri

Based on the novel by F.M. Dostoevsky. The tragic story of the Karamazov family takes place in the Russian province at the end of the 19th century. The relationship between the father and three brothers who are completely different from each other is complex and contradictory. One of the brothers is accused of murdering father, which he did not commit. The brothers are unable to help him, and only a loving girl follows him to hard labor. 

After the death of director Ivan Pyriev , work on the film was completed by actors M. Ulyanov and K. Lavrov.

youtube-IN-k8Dw-XbI.title: The Man of the Capuchin boulevard

sources.description:
A strange man, Johnny First, arrives in a small Western town. He doesn’t drink whiskey, doesn’t shoot with or without reason, he organizes movie shows in the saloon. The town is being transformed. Mesmerizing new art elevates the simple, raw souls of cowboys. And Johnny himself finds here his only and great love - Diana. However, the noble hero is hampered by hostile forces - a bartender who is losing his clients, a pastor who is an unlucky admirer of Diana, and Mr. Second, who introduces viewers to low-grade cruel films.

Kostya Inochkin is expelled from the pioneer camp. Not wanting to bring his grandmother to a heart attack with his early arrival, the boy secretly returns to the camp, where he goes into an "illegal position". Friends help him to remain unnoticed and take all measures so that the parent's day does not take place. After all, it is on this day that Kostin’s grandmother will come to the camp ...

youtube--CEjVACmuUg.title: فارس اسمه الموت | فيلم تاريخي | فيلم كامل | مع ترجمة عربية

sources.description:
روسيا في أوائل القرن العشرين. الإرهابيون يخططون لاغتيال رجال دولة بارزين. هدفهم الرئيسي هو اغتيال دوق روسيا الأكبر. يتم التحضير لمحاولة الاغتيال من قبل أعضاء التنظيم المتشدد بقيادة زعيمها جورج. تكشف عملية تنظيم هجوم إرهابي عن نفسية ومشاعر وتطلعات الإرهابيين ، ولكل منهم أسباب مختلفة لفعل ما يفعله. فشلت محاولات الاغتيال الواحدة تلو الأخرى ، وقُتل كل منظميها تقريبًا. يدرك الناجي جورج فجأة أن اغتيال دوق روسيا الأكبر أصبح الهدف الوحيد في حياته ، وسيبذل قصارى جهده لتنفيذ خطته. يرتكب جريمة قتل جريئة ولكن ينتهي بخيبة أمل.

سنة الصنع: 2004

The end of the 1950s. Four geologists are searching for diamonds in the Siberian taiga. After a long and exhausting work, the diamond tube is mapped. The heroes rejoice at their victory, dream of returning home soon, of meeting with their relatives. But a natural disaster occurs - the taiga is engulfed in fire for many miles around, cutting off the path to boats with food and equipment.

youtube-49SWSKo4UcU.title: Come and See | WAR FILM | with Arabic subtitles

sources.description:
1943 ، الحرب الوطنية العظمى ، أراضي بيلاروسيا. ذهب الصبي فليرا البالغ من العمر 16 عامًا ، بعد أن حفر كاربينًا بين قصاصات من الأسلاك الشائكة وأحزمة الرشاشات الصدئة وخوذات الرصاص ، إلى الغابة للانضمام إلى صفوف الثوار.

هذا الفيلم ، لا مثيل له ، يُظهر مأساة طفل في ساحة المعركة. في بداية الصورة ، فليرا مجرد مراهق. لكن في النهاية ، بعد أن مرّ بالرعب والخوف ، يصبح الطفل بالغًا ، وبالغ المخيف - وجهه مشوه بتجاعيد الشيخوخة ، ولا يوجد مكان للحب في روحه ...

Julio de 1942. En las afueras de Stalingrado, las tropas soviéticas exhaustas y agotadas están librando duras batallas defensivas, sufriendo enormes pérdidas. La película trata sobre una hazaña de soldados ordinarios, sobre el amor humano a la tierra natal, sobre el precio real de la victoria.

Una adaptación cinematográfica de la novela de Mikhail Sholokhov.

Intérpretes: Vasily Shukshin, Vyacheslav Tikhonov, Sergei Bondarchuk, Georgi Burkov, Yury Nikulin

تنتشر شائعات لا تصدق بين الجنود السوفييت حول دبابة ألمانية غامضة تظهر فجأة وتختفي في ساحة المعركة ، وتدمر كل شيء في طريقها. هذا هو النمر الأبيض ، الشيطان الذي لا يستطيع أحد تحمله. بعد إحدى هذه المعارك ، تم العثور على سائق دبابة محترق بشدة في دبابة سوفيتية معطلة. إن النجاة من مثل هذه الحروق الرهيبة أمر مستحيل ، لكن سائق الدبابة يتعافى بسرعة. الأطباء في حيرة من أمرهم ويرمون أيديهم ، مؤكدين أنها معجزة. ومع ذلك ، لا يتذكر هذا الرجل من هو ، ومن أين أتى ، لكنه يعرف شيئًا واحدًا - الدبابة الألمانية الغامضة موجودة بالفعل. يعتقد أن الحرب أعادته إلى حياته لتخليص العالم من الدبابة القاتلة ، النمر الأبيض. ما هذا؟ الخيال؟ سراب؟ سلاح الرايخ الثالث السري؟ أم أنه اكتشف السر المطلق للحرب؟

سنة الصنع: 2012

sources.description:

Version with English subtitles is available here: https://youtu.be/Q3hBLv-HLEc

Basado en la novela "Picnic en la carretera" de Arkady y Boris Strugatsky. La Zona que surgió en la Tierra por razones desconocidas llama la atención con fenómenos inexplicables que ocurren allí. Se ha difundido el rumor de que en el centro de la Zona hay algo que le da a una persona todo lo que quiere. Pero permanecer en la Zona es mortal y, por lo tanto, está estrictamente vigilada. Allí, cada uno por sus propios motivos, van el Escritor y el Profesor, el Acechador los conduce al misterioso centro, sintiendo y comprendiendo la Zona...

Many adventures - funny, sad, sometimes dramatic - will happen to Valiko before he becomes a pilot for an international airline. His dream has come true, but is he happy far from his native mountainous land?

Based on the story of L. Slavin. Thirty-year-old unmarried Nyura works as a saleswoman in a provincial town. Her life is uneventful. And it seems to Nyura that somewhere life boils and sparkles with bright carnival colors. One day she goes to a seaside resort and meets Sanya there. He is rustic and not spectacular - bears little resemblance to the bridegroom of girlish dreams. And Nyura runs away from him... Or maybe this is happiness - is it so simple and natural?

“Si una persona no tiene coraje, no puede ser un buen bailarín de claqué”, dice Beglov, que alguna vez fue un bailarín de claqué muy popular. Sin embargo, ahora es olvidado por todos y vive solo en recuerdos de su antigua gloria, pluriempleo como tutor de baile. Y un día se le acerca un estudiante extraño: Arkady tiene un modo de andar asqueroso, una pierna rota en dos lugares y sin ningún sentido del ritmo. ¡Pero con muchas ganas de aprender a bailar claqué! Esta reunión será necesaria para ambos: Arkady le dará a Beglov la atmósfera habitual de la vida pop, y Beglov le enseñará al joven a sentir el mundo de manera más sutil.

La Gran Guerra Patria. Al joven soldado Alyosha Skvortsov se le dan unos días libres para que pueda visitar a su madre. En el camino a su pueblo natal, se encuentra con personas a las que no puede pasar: ayuda a todos, no tiene derecho a rechazar a nadie. Y los días que le dieron para conocer a su madre se derriten ante nuestros ojos... Casi no hay escenas de batalla en la película, porque la guerra no es solo muerte, la guerra es también esa vida.

Das Ende der 1980er Jahre in der UdSSR. Der Moskauer Schulabsolvent Ivan Miroshnikov besteht seine Aufnahmeprüfungen nicht und beginnt als Kurier in der Redaktion der Zeitschrift Questions of Cognition zu arbeiten. Ivan lernt Professor Kusnezows Tochter Katja kennen. Junge Menschen gehören unterschiedlichen sozialen Schichten an, aber trotz Unterschieden in Erziehung, Lebensstandard, Gewohnheiten und Zielen haben beide immer mindestens eines gemeinsam: den Wunsch nach Selbstverwirklichung. Eine aufrichtige und etwas traurige Existenzkomödie über einen Perestroika-Helden ist bis heute einer der beliebtesten Filme in Russland.

الفيلم مأخوذ عن فيلم Two in the Steppe ، وهو قصة كتبها الكاتب السوفيتي المخضرم الشهير إيمانويل كازاكيفيتش ومذكرات حرب كونستانتين سيمونوف. 1942. تحقق محكمة عسكرية في أفعال الشاب المعتقل عديم الخبرة الملازم أوجاركوف.

يعتقد الضابط إيفان سينييف ، الذي كان في مهمة مع أوغاركوف ، أن أوغاركوف أظهر الجبن. حكمت المحكمة العسكرية على أوغاركوف بإطلاق النار عليه. سيحرس الجندي دزوراباييف المعتقل حتى تنفيذ الحكم. فجأة دخل الألمان القرية واخترقوا الدفاعات. يتخذ Dzhurabayev القرار الصحيح الوحيد - لاقتحام قواته مع Ogarkov. والآن يسير حارس وسجين على الطرق العسكرية ويخوضان معارك عشوائية على قدم المساواة. يغطون أنفسهم بنفس المعطف ، ويأكلون من نفس العلبة. تنشأ بينهما صداقة صامتة ومستحيلة ...

La película "El espejo" representa reflejos, pensamientos de la persona nombrada aquí como el autor. No aparece personalmente, solo suena su voz cansada. Y en la pantalla, como en un espejo, hay imágenes de su pasado. Al principio, los recuerdos parecen dispersos: amor por la madre, que el Autor no sabe cómo expresar, un sentimiento penetrante por el padre, insatisfacción consigo mismo por la relación no desarrollada con su hijo ... Poco a poco se vuelve claro: esto es el relato de una persona sobre sí misma, un juicio de conciencia difícil, tal vez incluso una sentencia. La película ocupa un lugar especial en la obra de Andrei Tarkovsky. En él, capturó a su anciana madre Maria Ivanovna Vishnyakova-Tarkovsky, detrás de escena suena la voz de su padre, el poeta Arseny Tarkovsky, recitando sus maravillosos poemas. Es una película de confesión, una película de revelación...

youtube-WyFMJdIPmMo.title: Poisons, or the world history of poisoning

sources.description:
Eine Version mit englischen Untertiteln ist auf unserem Kanal verfügbar: https://youtu.be/bvChOTAsHec

Der Theaterschauspieler Oleg Volkov ist sich sicher, dass seine Frau ihn betrügt. Schweren Herzens sitzt er in einer Bar und überlegt, was er tun soll. Der imposante Rentner Ivan Petrovich trifft Oleg, mit dem der betrogene Ehemann seine Probleme teilt. Und Ivan Petrovich hat eine Lösung! Es ist notwendig, einfach ... den untreuen Ehepartner zu vergiften. Schließlich ist diese Methode so alt wie die Welt. Einst nahm Sokrates Hemlock-Gift, als das Athener Gericht ihn zum Tode verurteilte ... Und die Zeit im Film ging zurück und führte die Zuschauer in das alte Persien und das mittelalterliche Rom, zu den großen Vergiftungen aller Epochen und Völker - aus den Geschichten des persischen Königs Xerxes an Katharina von Medici. Im Allgemeinen beginnt die Weltgeschichte der Vergiftungen.

The historical drama by Andrei Tarkovsky was filmed in 1966 at the Mosfilm studio. The plot of the picture is dedicated to the life of the icon painter Andrei Rublev. In 1967, the premiere took place - the tape was severely criticized for gloom, excessive naturalism.

The film was recutt, and after a limited release, it was effectively shelved. Subsequently, the picture was recognized as one of the main works of the director and today is included in various ratings of the best films in the history of world cinema.

And now Tarkovsky's tape is available in the original author's intention, with the return of some previously deleted scenes - for film critics and all fans of the director's work.

sources.description:
La película está basada en Two in the Steppe, una historia del famoso escritor veterano soviético Emmanuil Kazakevich y los diarios de guerra de Konstantin Simonov. 1942. Un tribunal militar está investigando las acciones de un joven teniente sin experiencia arrestado Ogarkov.

El oficial Ivan Sinyayev, que estaba en una misión junto con Ogarkov, piensa que Ogarkov mostró cobardía. El tribunal militar condena a fusilar a Ogarkov. El soldado Dzhurabayev custodiará al detenido hasta la ejecución de la sentencia. De repente, los alemanes entran en el pueblo, rompiendo las defensas. Dzhurabayev toma la única decisión correcta: abrirse paso hacia sus tropas junto con Ogarkov. Y ahora un guardia y un prisionero caminan por los caminos militares, participando en batallas aleatorias como iguales. Se cubren con el mismo abrigo, comen de la misma lata. Una amistad silenciosa e imposible se desarrolla entre ellos...

Un drama de guerra dirigido por Nikolai Lebedev. La película está basada en un cuento del mismo nombre de Emmanuil Kazakevich. 

En 1944, se envió un grupo de exploradores del Ejército Rojo detrás de la línea del frente para aclarar la información sobre la formación enemiga. Después de cruzar la línea del frente, los soldados se convencen gradualmente de que el enemigo está reagrupando en secreto sus fuerzas para una contraofensiva decisiva. sources.description:
1943, la Gran Guerra Patriótica, territorio de Bielorrusia. El joven Flera, de 16 años, después de haber desenterrado una carabina entre restos de alambre de púas, cinturones de ametralladoras oxidados y cascos perforados, se adentra en el bosque para unirse a las filas de los partisanos.

Esta película, como ninguna otra, muestra la tragedia de un niño en un campo de batalla. Al comienzo de la imagen, Flera es solo una adolescente. Pero al final, después de haber pasado por el horror y el miedo, el niño se convierte en un adulto, terriblemente adulto: su rostro está distorsionado por arrugas seniles, y no hay lugar para el amor en su alma...

Student Shurik comes to one of the small mountainous republics to study the customs, rituals and folklore of the highlanders. Mientras tanto, los personajes principales, Sergei, Lyuda y su amigo común Stepan estudian sin preocupaciones en el Instituto. Sergei comienza a cortejar conmovedoramente a la amable y confiada Lyuda, y comienzan un hermoso romance. Sin embargo, pronto aparece una recién llegada en el grupo: la chica espectacular Katya, y Sergei comienza a coquetear con ella. Al enterarse de esto, Lyuda acusa a Sergei de traición. Una adaptación a gran escala de los clásicos rusos, basada en la gran novela de Leo Nikolayevich Tolstoy "Ana Karénina".

1904 Guerra Ruso-Japonesa. Manchuria. El hospital militar ruso, en retirada, ocupa un pueblo chino semiabandonado. El director del hospital, Sergei Karénin, se entera de que el oficial herido al que está operando, el conde Vrónski, es quien mató a su madre, Ana Karénina, e indirectamente causó la muerte de su padre. Sin hacerse ilusiones y sin esperar una respuesta, Karénin, sin embargo, acude a Vrónski y le hace la pregunta que lo ha atormentado toda su vida: ¿qué hizo que su madre cruzara la línea? Earl Vrónski, a su vez, se entera de que el médico es el mismo Seryozha Karénin. Después de algunas dudas, el conde accede a contar la historia de su trágico amor por Ana Karénina, señalando que las personas recuerdan solo lo que les conviene recordar...

La fin des années 1980 en URSS. Diplômé de l'école de Moscou, Ivan Miroshnikov échoue à ses examens d'entrée à l'université et commence à travailler comme coursier à la rédaction du Journal Questions of Cognition. Ivan fait la connaissance de Katya, la fille du professeur Kuznetsov. Les jeunes appartiennent à des couches sociales différentes, mais malgré les différences d'éducation, de niveau de vie, d'habitudes et d'objectifs, ils ont toujours au moins une chose en commun : le désir de s'exprimer. Une comédie existentielle sincère et quelque peu triste sur un héros de la perestroïka reste à ce jour l'un des films les plus populaires en Russie.

A pedido del público, presentamos la película El Tigre Blanco con subtítulos en Español.

Circulan rumores increíbles entre los soldados soviéticos sobre un misterioso tanque alemán que aparece y desaparece repentinamente en el campo de batalla, destruyendo todo a su paso. Este es el Tigre Blanco, el demonio que nadie puede manejar. Después de una de esas batallas, un conductor de tanque gravemente quemado se encuentra en un tanque soviético averiado. Sobrevivir a quemaduras tan monstruosas es imposible, pero el conductor del tanque se está recuperando rápidamente. Los médicos están perplejos y levantan las manos, asegurando que es un milagro. Aún así, este hombre no recuerda quién es, de dónde viene, pero sabe una cosa: el místico tanque alemán existe. Él cree que la guerra le ha devuelto la vida para librar al mundo del tanque asesino, el White Tiger. ¿Que es eso? ¿Una fantasía? ¿Un espejismo? ¿El arma secreta del Tercer Reich? ¿O descubrió el último secreto de la guerra?

A pedido del público, presentamos la película Dersu Uzala con subtítulos en Español.

Basada en la obra del científico y escritor, célebre viajero y explorador del Lejano Oriente
V. Arseniev. La historia de su amistad con el guía Dersu Uzala con extraordinarias cualidades personales. Su viaje por la taiga-bosque, lleno de peligrosas aventuras, es el argumento de la película, pero el sentido de la historia va mucho más allá de la trama: es una historia sobre la hermandad de las personas, que todos somos hijos de una misma tierra.

By the time Ivan Vasilyevich returned from Aleksandrovskaya Sloboda, a boyar conspiracy had matured with the participation of the Polish Tsar Sigismund. Scenes of bloody reprisals against the boyars, with the recalcitrant Metropolitan Philip Kolychev, are interspersed with Grozny's childhood memories. Andrei Rublev, Drama, directed by Andrei Tarkovsky

The picture unfolds a wide panorama of the life in Russia at the beginning of the 15th century, when the Russian genius artist Andrei Rublev lived and worked. His creations showed the world a miracle of harmony, beauty, light, hope - and all this at a time when the country is torn apart by princely civil strife, and Tatar raids, famine and pestilence are chasing the people. The film is divided into eight short stories, which have little plot connection with each other, but paint a general picture of medieval Russia, which is taking shape like a mosaic work.
The film was included in the 100 best films in the history of cinema, according to a survey of film critics of the world in 1978.

"The Mirror" movie represents reflections, thoughts of the person named here as the Author. He does not appear personally, only his tired voice sounds. And on the screen, as if in a mirror, are pictures of his past. At first, the memories seem scattered: love for the mother, which the Author does not know how to express, a piercing feeling for the father, dissatisfaction with himself for the undeveloped relationship with his son ... Gradually it becomes clear - this is a person’s account of himself, a difficult judgment of conscience, maybe even a sentence. The film occupies a special place in the work of Andrei Tarkovsky. In it, he captured his aged mother Maria Ivanovna Vishnyakova-Tarkovsky, behind the scenes the voice of his father, the poet Arseny Tarkovsky, reciting his wonderful poems sounds. It's a confession film, a revelation film...

youtube-bvChOTAsHec.title: Poisons or the World History of Poisoning

sources.description:
Theater actor Oleg Volkov is sure that his wife is cheating on him. With a heavy heart, he sits in a bar and thinks what to do. The imposing pensioner Ivan Petrovich meets Oleg, with whom the deceived husband shares his problems. And Ivan Petrovich has a solution! It is necessary to simply ... poison the unfaithful spouse. After all, this method is as old as the world. At one time, Socrates took hemlock poison when the Athenian court sentenced him to death... And the time in the film went back, taking viewers to ancient Persia and medieval Rome, to the great poisonings of all eras and peoples - from the stories of the Persian king Xerxes to Catherine de Medici . In general, the world history of poisonings begins.

sources.description:
Part One: https://youtu.be/b8f0ohBqNGw

Based on the novel by S. Tsvigun "We'll be back". The second film of the trilogy ("Front without flanks", "Front behind the front line", "Front behind enemy lines") about a special detachment led by Major Mlynsky. 1944 The German command is developing Operation Bismarck, the purpose of which is to disorientate Soviet intelligence by planting false information and setting a trap for the Soviet troops. At this time, work is underway in Germany on a new secret "superweapon", with which the Nazis pin their hopes of victory. Soviet intelligence officers manage to unravel the enemy's plan and discover a strategically important, secret, powerfully fortified area under the signature stamp "Zone "B". In an effort to destroy the Mlynsky detachment and his commander personally, the Germans create a false partisan detachment "For the Motherland". And from this cruel and difficult duel the detachment Mlynsky comes out with honor, defeating the false partisans.

Year of production: 1977

Directed by: Gostev Igor
Writted by: Semyon Dneprov
Music: Basner Veniamin
Operator: Kharitonov Alexander
Production Designers: Alexander Samulekin, Vasily Golikov

Starting by: Ivan Pereverzev, Vladislav Strzhelchik, Galina Polskikh, Svetlana Sukhovey, Viktor Shulgin, Evgeny Leonov-Gladyshev, Vladimir Samoilov, Evgeny Shutov, Marina Dyuzheva, Afanasy Kochetkov, Tatiana Bozhok, Igor Ledogorov, Vyacheslav Tikhonov

youtube-eVp7Nf6pQnI.title: The Fall of Berlin, Part Two | WAR MOVIE

sources.description:
Part One: https://youtu.be/AJyi2BJnmO4

The legendary epic picture about events of the Great Patriotic War. The storyline of the steelworker Alexei Ivanov, who volunteered for the front, is woven into the historical context. All the most important events of the war are shown through Alexei's personal participation in them: from the famous military parade in November 1941 near the Kremlin walls to the hoisting of the Victory Banner over the Reichstag in May 1945. In the final scene, Stalin arrives in Berlin and is enthusiastically greeted by people of various nationalities, including Alexei and his girlfriend Natasha.

Year of production: 1949

Directed by: Chiaureli Mikhail
Writted by: Petr Pavlenko, Mikhail Chiaureli
Music: Shostakovich Dmitry
Operator: Kosmatov Leonid

Nadya Klyueva, a very nice employee of one research institute cannot arrange her personal life. She is more than thirty years old, and still unmarried. Occasionally, she meets her former schoolmate Susanna in a bus. 

After that Nadya's life begins to change. Susanna is a professional sociologist and gives Nadya practical advice on how to change her behaviour and clothing to get married successfully. The object of Nadya's courtship is her colleague Volodya, frivolous "Don Juan". Based on Masha Traub's story "The House in the South". An enterprising broker rented a house by the sea to several families at once. So, by chance, in one "ark" several completely different women with children are forced to "sail on the waves of life". After a tangle of eccentric, funny events, showdowns, it seemed that they would understand each other, but the appearance of the owner of the house returning from the voyage, and unaware that his friend, to whom he gave the keys to the house, handed it over, violates the already almost emerged Chekhovian atmosphere.

“If a person does not have courage, he cannot be a good tap dancer,” says Beglov, once a very popular tap dancer. However, now he is forgotten by everyone and lives only in memories of his former glory, moonlighting as a dance tutor. And one day a strange student comes to him: Arkady has a disgusting gait, a broken leg in two places and without any sense of rhythm. But with a great desire to learn to tap dance! This meeting will be necessary for both: Arkady will give Beglov the usual atmosphere of pop life, and Beglov will teach the young man to feel the world more subtly.

Semyon Gorbunkov goes on a cruise. In Istanbul, he slips and breaks his arm. What he didn't know is that this was a signal for a gang of smugglers (a real smuggler - Gena - was also on the same ship). So his arm gets bandaged with gold and diamonds. After he returns home, the gangsters are trying to get their stuff back, while the police try to catch them using Gorbunkov and his arm.

One of comedies who preserves the flavor of a period and reflects the sensitivity of a generation. So, it is not just a comedy but a trip in Soviet every day reality. The inspired cast, the smart use of clichés and gags are the best ingredients for create a lesson about Soviet Union. A film who explores situations for a fresh image of social situations. A comedy which has the gift to do different image of era, using irony and the clichés, desires and nuances. A film who remains lovely decade by decade, and that fact is the basic virtue of film. 

Year of production: 1968

A new chief of a "Culture House" is planning to hold a terribly boring New Year concert. A group of young amateur actors are doing their best to liven up the concert.

Obviously, no one wants to change the program with only a few hours before the show, much less to replace it with something so boring. So everyone teams up in order to prevent Ogurtsov from getting to the stage. They manage to trap Ogurtsov by any means necessary so that the acts can perform their scheduled pieces, and celebrate New Year's Eve as originally planned.

youtube-ms5Ga6kNvHM.title: The Irony of Fate, Part One | ROMANTIC COMEDY

sources.description:
Part Two: https://youtu.be/luHarTc90QA

On December 31, the American version of the Russian film "The Irony of Fate, or Enjoy Your Bath!" Will be released on the Netflix platform. Here is the original story of the Soviet director Eldar Ryazanov. Favorite New Year movie of all Russians!

FIRST EPISODE. The Irony of Fate, or Enjoy Your Bath!  is a 1976 Soviet romantic comedy television film directed by Eldar Ryazanov. The screenplay was written by Emil Braginsky and Ryazanov, loosely based on the director's 1971 play, Once on New Year's Eve. Filmed in 1975 at the Mosfilm Studios, The Irony of Fate doubles as a screwball comedy and a love story tinged with sadness. It was one of the most successful Soviet television productions and remains a highly popular New Year's Eve classic in Russia and the post-Soviet states, with millions tuning in to rewatch it every New Year's Eve.

The key subplot is the drab uniformity of Brezhnev-era public architecture. This setting is explained in a humorous animated prologue, in which architects are overruled by politicians and red tape. As a result, the identical, functional but unimaginative multistory apartment buildings found their way into every city, town, and suburb across the Soviet Union.

Following their annual tradition, a group of friends meet at a banya (a traditional public "sauna" bath) in Moscow to celebrate New Year's Eve. The friends all get very drunk toasting the upcoming marriage of the central male character, Zhenya Lukashin (Andrey Myagkov) to Galya (Olga Naumenko). After the bath, one of the friends, Pavlik (Aleksandr Shirvindt), has to catch a plane to Leningrad. Zhenya, on the other hand, is supposed to go home to celebrate New Year's Eve with his fiancée. Both Zhenya and Pavlik pass out. The remaining friends cannot remember which person from their group is supposed to catch the plane. They mistakenly send Zhenya on the plane instead of Pavlik.

Year of production: 1976

Directed by: Ryazanov Eldar
Writed by: Ryazanov Eldar, Braginsky Emil
Music: Mikael Tariverdiev
Operator: Nakhabtsev Vladimir
Production designer: Borisov Alexander
Starring: Dobrzhanskaya Lyubov, Akhedzhakova Leah, Myagkov Andrey, Yakovlev Yuri, Brylska Barbara, Naumenko Olga, Belyavsky Alexander, Burkov Georgy, Roninson Gotlib, Sokolova Lyubov, Talyzina Valentina, Shirvindt Alexander

sources.description:
Film II: Typhoon

Part One: https://youtu.be/CNxckympMp4

Part Two:  The enemy is at the outskirts of the city, yet the traditional 7 November parade takes place as always. Zoya Kosmodemyanskaya is captured and executed, and Panfilov's men fight to the last. Rokossovsky begs Zhukov to allow retreat but is refused. After all seems lost, the Germans grind to a halt because of the harsh winter. On 6 December, the Soviets launch a successful counter-offensive by using the air force, the cavalry, tanks, and ski troops. Forcing the Germans to retreat, causing Hitler to blame his generals.

Part One: https://youtu.be/ceRHLKJCWTM

Soviet two-part war film, presenting a dramatized account of the 1941 Battle of Moscow and the events preceding it. The films were a Soviet-East German-Czechoslovak-Vietnamese co-production directed by Yuri Ozerov who also wrote the script. It was made in time for the 40th anniversary of the Allied victory over Nazi Germany and the 20th anniversary of the proclamation of the Victory Day holiday and Moscow's declaration as a Hero City.

youtube-ceRHLKJCWTM.title: The Battle for Moscow AGRESSION, Part One | WAR MOVIE

sources.description:
Film I: Agression

Part One: In the aftermath of the victory in France, Hitler decides to attack the Soviet Union and places his hopes on field marshal Fedor von Bock, commander of Army Group Center, for the capture of Moscow. Ilse Stöbe, Rudolf von Scheliha and Richard Sorge inform of the danger, but the Soviet intelligence dismisses their warnings. Zhukov is concerned that the army is ill-prepared; Pavlov decries him as a fear-monger. The Red Army officers are convinced that in the event of an invasion, they would immediately counter-attack. On 22 June 1941 Germany launches Operation Barbarossa, overwhelming the Soviets.

Insurance agent Yury Detochkin, a crystal-clear and naive person, goes out on the warpath with bribe-takers and profiteers. Driven by a sense of justice, he acts in a peculiar manner, stealing cars from people who acquired them unfairly, selling them, and passing the money to orphanages. In the prosecutor’s office, the cases of these thefts are handled by Detective Podberyozovikov, a friend of Detochkin’s...

Based on the play by Anton Chekhov. End of 19th century, Russian province. The film is set in a family manor house whose inhabitants are bored with their lives, which they view as pointlessly and needlessly wasted. For many years the country estate has been looked after by Ivan Petrovich Voynitsky. 

Uncle Vanya, a Russian intellectual barely making ends meet in these backwoods, falls in love with a woman who happens to be on his estate ...
While making the film, the director set out to preserve the style and content of the original theatre piece as much as possible.

The film is recognised as one of the most successful adaptations of Chekhov's plays.

youtube-ZEhdKWA7WC4.title: Anna Karenina, Part Eight | ORIGINAL SERIES | by Karen Shakhnazarov

sources.description:
A large-scale adaptation of Russian classics - a multi-part film based on the great novel by Leo Nikolayevich Tolstoy "Anna Karenina"

1904 Russo-Japanese War. Manchuria. The Russian military hospital, retreating, occupies a semi-abandoned Chinese village. The head of the hospital, Sergei Karenin, learns that the wounded officer he is operating on, earl Vronsky, is the one who killed his mother, Anna Karenina, and indirectly caused the death of his father. Having no illusions and not expecting an answer, Karenin nevertheless goes to Vronsky and asks the question that has tormented him all his life: what made his mother cross the line? earl Vronsky, in turn, learns that the doctor is the same Seryozha Karenin. After some hesitation, the count agrees to tell the story of his tragic love for Anna Karenina, noting that people remember only what is convenient for them to remember...

sources.description:
A drama by Nikita Mikhalkov.

Based on the work of Anton Chekhov. The film is set at a nobleman's estate in summertime. Anna Petrovna Voynitseva, an eccentric general’s widow, has guests coming over. Here, after many years of not seeing each other, Mikhail Platonov and Sophia meet again. As a smart and talented young man, Platonov had seen a brilliant career in front of him. Now at the age of 35, he works as a teacher in a provincial grammar school, a loser with ambitions. Sophia, on the other hand, is now a respectable, well-mannered married lady...

An absurdist comedy by Karen Shakhnazarov.

Engineer Varakin comes from Moscow to a small town on business. He needs to find out why the local factory stopped supplying spare parts. However, the first thing he sees at the factory is a completely naked secretary at the Director’s reception. But no one else seems fazed by this embarrassing circumstance. Every day the engineer faces situations that are becoming increasingly more bizarre. On top of all that, Varakin finds out that cannot leave the town.

Year of production: 1988

Directed by: Karen Shakhnazarov

#comedy_of_the_absurd #FullMoviesWithEngSubs

Maria Konovalova, a simple but hearty woman from the village, goes to the city to visit her daughter and beloved granddaughter. On the train, she meets a chief engineer of a fish processing factory, also a senior, but a very kind and friendly person. The simple-hearted woman had no idea what kind of life her nearest and dearest had in the city, and perhaps, the only family she had. She soon learns that her daughter does not love her husband, whom she does not live with, although she is not divorced. She doesn’t love her job, which she put herself through just to leave the village. Overall, she doesn’t seem too fond of her life. All of this negatively affects Maria’s granddaughter. Maria tries to establish her daughter’s home and family relationships with absolute directness and the best intentions, bringing much frustration to those close to her.

At work, mediocre coursemate Varvara shamelessly exploits Buzykin’s talents and also interferes in his private life. He even jogs in the morning against his will at the insistence of his guest, a Danish Professor Hanson, specializing in Slavic studies.

A Soviet-Cuban two-part feature film directed by Mikhail Kalatozov, released in 1964. The film was shot after the triumph of the Cuban revolution, the advent of the socialist regime in Cuba, and allied relations between Cuba and the USSR.

Plot-wise, it consists of four unrelated novellas that tell the story of the Cubans fighting against "American oppressors" to turn their country into the Island of Liberty. In the 1960s, due to the rise of socialist ideals, the theme of revolution became relevant both for Soviet and Western cinema.
The film is made on a high professional level, primarily due to the innovations of DP Sergey Urusevsky and his crew. This was the last time Urusevsky, and director Kalatozov worked together. The films’s production was challenging in regards to staging, camerawork, intraframe editing, hand-held shooting for creating dynamic scenes using a hand-held camera in motion and transferring it from hand to hand, using specially made engineering structures, etc.

The film was shot between 1963 and 1964 with a considerable support from the Soviet and Cuban authorities during one of the most strained episodes of the Cold War - the Cuban Missile Crisis, the US blockade of the island, and the difficult economic situation in Cuba.

Year of production: 1964

Directed by: Mikhail Kalatozov
Written by: Yevgeny Yevtushenko, Enrique Pineda Barnet
Director of photography: Sergei Urusevsky
Music: Carlos Fariñas
Production designer: Yevgeni Svidetelev
Starring: Sergio Corrieri, José Gallardo, Raúl García, Salvador Wood, Luz María Collazo, Jean Bouise, Celia Rodriguez

The film was digitally restored by Mosfilm Cinema Concern

The end of the 1980s in the USSR. Moscow school graduate Ivan Miroshnikov fails his entrance college exams and start working as a courier in the editorial office of the Journal Questions of Cognition. Ivan gets acquainted with Professor Kuznetsov’s daughter Katya. Young people belong to different social strata, but despite differences in upbringing, living standards, habits, and goals, they both always have at least one thing in common: the desire for self-expression. A sincere and somewhat sad existential comedy about a perestroika hero remains to this day one of the most popular films in Russia.

One of the most important documentary films about fascism by Soviet director Mikhail Romm. Based entirely on newsreel shooting by cinematographers and photographers from Germany, the Soviet Union, the United States, Italy, Britain, and other countries, the film is based on authentic documents from numerous historical archives. The entire film is accompanied by the voiceover of film director Mikhail Romm. With anger and pain, with deep sadness, and at times with a murderous irony, he comments on events, reflects on dictatorships and dictators, on the crowd that submits to them and deifies them, speaking confidentially to the viewer. With his outstanding film, Mikhail Romm truly revolutionized documentary filmmaking.

sources.description:
The story is about a psychiatrist Smirnov who came to replace the retiring head doctor of a local mental hospital. His attention was drawn to Timofeev, a longtime clinic patient, an ex-convict suffering from an alternating personality. During periods of exacerbation of this disease, the patient considers himself a murderer of Alexander II and Nicholas II, Emperors of Russia. Doctor Smirnov takes an interest in this unique case and begins to actively study the unusual patient. Smirnov’s predecessor believed that “there are things in the human mind that are better never to be touched,” but the new doctor advocates a different treatment. 

How will conversations with the patient and the revelation of the circumstances of the historical execution affect the doctor? And where will such shock therapy lead to in the end?

Participant in the Main Competition at the Cannes Film Festival (1991). A psychological drama with mystical elements.

A Soviet ‘Red Western’ classic. The Russian civil war is over, but Basmachi gangs still roam Central Asia. Fyodor Ivanovich Sukhov, a Red Army soldier, intends to return home to his beloved wife Katerina Matveyevna, but unexpected events force him to stay in the desert. The brutal bandit Abdullah and his gang kill everyone in their path and threaten to destroy the women of their leader’s former harem. 

Fun facts: Film scholars believed that White Sun of the Desert had much in common with such films as The Passenger by Antonioni, The Sheltering Sky by Bertolucci, and Soviet movie The Thirteen by Mikhail Romm. In 2021, a distant Western reference might be Django Unchained by Quentin Tarantino. Therefore, the genre of the movie is vague. Film critics define the movie as a western, a red western (or eastern), and even an action flick. Many quotes from White Sun of the Desert have become catchphrases in Russian culture. The song Your Noble Highness Lady Fortune, written especially for the movie, became a hit.

The Red Western as a genre, with films such as The Elusive Avengers, Dauria, At Home Among the Strangers, and White Sun of the Desert, to name a few, became a relevant phenomenon in the Soviet film industry, causing a wave of imitations in the 60-70s, both in central studios and in film studios of the Central Asian republics.

Year of production: 1969

sources.description:
The movie is based on Two in the Steppe, a story by the famous Soviet veteran writer Emmanuil Kazakevich and war diaries by Konstantin Simonov. 1942. A military tribunal is investigating the actions of an arrested inexperienced young lieutenant Ogarkov. 

Officer Ivan Sinyayev, who was on a mission together with Ogarkov, thinks that Ogarkov showed cowardice. The military court sentences Ogarkov to be shot. Private Dzhurabayev is to guard the detainee until the execution of the sentence. Suddenly the Germans enter the village, breaking through the defenses. Dzhurabayev takes the only right decision - to break through to his troops together with Ogarkov. And now a guard and a prisoner are walking along the military roads, engaging in random battles as equals. They cover themselves with the same overcoat, eat from the same tin. A silent, impossible friendship develops between them...

Action film about a special operation to eliminate the terrorist Shamil Basayev. The film is based on actual events and touches on one of the most horrific pages of the recent past of the Russian Federation. As a result of a highly complex operation of the special services, terrorist leader Shamil Basayev was killed. It was him who became the prototype of the main negative character in the movie, Shamil Bazgayev. 

Shamil Basayev is responsible for heinous acts of terrorism: 
- The Budennovsk attack (1995)
- The kidnapping of Doctors Without Borders worker in Chechnya (2001) 
- Nord-Ost siege (2002)
- Suicide bombing of the Chechen government headquarters (2002)
- Series of suicide bombings (2003)
- Bombing of gas pipelines and power transmission lines in the Moscow region (2004)
- Terrorist attack in Grozny on May 9, 2004
- Terrorist attacks in Moscow (2004)
- Airplane Explosions (2004)
- The Beslan school siege (2004)
- Power system breakdown in Moscow
- Arson at the Stanislavsky and Nemirovich-Danchenko Theater (2005)

The script of Decision: Liquidation was based on the memories of the direct participants of the FSB operation.

¡Que viva México! is an unfinished movie by Sergei Eisenstein made between 1931 and 1932. The movie was conceived as a broad picture of life in Mexico in different eras and under different social systems. Eisenstein formulated the idea of the movie as follows: ¡Que viva México! is the history of the shifts of culture, given not vertically, in years and centuries, but horizontally, in the order of the geographical cohabitation of the most diverse stages of culture side by side - a unique feature of Mexico where provinces of reigning matriarchy (Tehuantepec) border regions of communism almost achieved in the revolution of the 1910s (Yucatan, Zapatismo, etc.). 

The making of Long Live Mexico has a fascinating history. In the autumn of 1929, a group of Soviet filmmakers headed by Eisenstein went to Hollywood, where they were supposed to learn the technique of sound cinema and produce a movie for Paramount Pictures. American and Mexican friends, including the famous artists Diego Rivera and David Siqueiros, writers Theodore Dreiser and Upton Sinclair, offered Eisenstein’s group an exciting idea with funding to shoot a feature movie about life in Mexico. 

In its original form, the movie consisted of two novellas, Sandunga and Maguey, and three episodes framing the novellas, the Prologue, the Spanish-Catholic Mexico scenes, and the Epilogue. 

The Prologue shows scenes of ancient Mexico, temples, and pyramids. Sandunga is an idyllic novella about matriarchal pre-colonial Mexico. The plot slowly unfolds around a young Indian couple. This novella was filmed in Oaxaca. 

Next, the viewer is introduced to Mexico after the Spanish conquest, which brought lavish festivities and the worship of the Blessed Virgin. Eisenstein managed to film the celebration of the 400th anniversary of the miraculous icon of Our Lady of Guadalupe, the patron saint of Mexico. He depicted here the self-torture of penitents, pilgrim processions, religious dances, and bullfighting. 
The second novella is called Maguey, Agave maguey juice is used to make pulque. The novella is set on a maguey plantation during the dictatorship of Porfirio Diaz. The audience is presented with pictures of the hard work and suffering of peons. A drunken guest of the hacienda owner takes peon Sebastian’s beloved girl away from him. But the peon decides to take revenge and burns down the owner’s estate with the help of his three friends. However, the peons are caught and end up with a painful execution, buried up to their necks in the sand and trampled by horses. 

The last and climactic novella, Soldadera, revolving around the Mexican Revolution, was not finished. As conceived by the director, it would tell the story of a girl named Pancha, the wife of a soldier of the Constitutional Army of Venustiano Carranza. Along with the other soldier’s wives, soldaderas who cook food for the troops and care for the wounded, she accompanies her husband on the campaigns. Her husband is killed on the battlefield, and Pancha becomes the wife of the enemy - a soldier fighting on Zapata’s side. It turns out that Pancha not only switches a husband but also joins another army, with which she enters Mexico City after joining Villa’s troops. In this way, Pancha embodies Mexico itself, driven by the fratricidal war between the various revolutionary forces. This novella would thus cap one of the themes of the movie - the relationship between a man and a woman - from a serene pastime in the pre-colonial era, to fighting for their rights in the feudal era, to ultimately fighting shoulder-to-shoulder in the revolution.
 
The last episode was supposed to be an Epilogue to celebrate the Day of the Dead. The viewer sees a parade of people dressed in skeleton costumes. There are skulls in tricornes of generals and ministers, skulls in toppers, and skeletons in bishop’s vestments. People in death masks dance to the sound of the rumba. But they take off their masks, and we see the faces of children, peons, and laborers. 

At various times, 80,000 meters of footage shot by Eisenstein’s group were edited into feature films Thunder over Mexico and Time under the Sun. Selected footage has been used in various films, such as Viva, Villa! In 1955, Sinclair donated the entire negative to the collection of the Museum of Modern Art in New York. Due to Sergei Eisenstein’s problems with the Soviet authorities and Stalin in particular, Soviet viewers saw Long Live Mexico! Only after the director died in 1979. Eisenstein’s co-director Grigori Alexandrov edited a version close to the original idea. 

Year of production: 1932, 1978 

Directed by: Sergei Eisenstein, Grigori Alexandrov, Nikita Orlov
Written by: Grigory Alexandrov,Sergei Eisenstein
Directors of photography: Eduard Tisse, Nikolai Olonovsky
Music: Yury Yakhushev
Production designer: Yury Sobolev
Starring: Sergei Bondarchuk (voiceover), Grigory Alexandrov (cameo)

Then they met during the Great War - they had only a few days of happiness, and then Sasha received the news of the death of her lover. But she did not believe it - she waited, raised her son, and Alexei returned. He had to go through a lot after the war. Alexei returned from captivity, so he was suspected of betrayal. Alexei, a former hero, started drinking, but Sasha did everything to support her loved one.

Year of production: 1961

Directed by: Grigory Chukhray
Written by: Daniil Khrabrovitsky
Director of photography: Sergey Poluyanov
Music: Mikhail Ziv
Production designer: Boris Nemechek
Starring: Nina Drobysheva, Yevgeny Urbansky

A drama directed by Eldar Ryazanov based on Alexander Ostrovsky’s play Bespridannitsa (Without a Dowry). The film gained admiration from the audience. In 1984, it was recognized as the best film of the year by Soviet Screen magazine and won several awards. A brilliant role for Nikita Mikhalkov and a tender debut for Larisa Guzeeva. The film differs significantly from its source material, and is considered by many a piece of work in its own right. It is set in a small provincial town on the coast of the Volga River. Kharita Ignatievna Ogudalova is a widow with three grown-up daughters. Having become poor after the death of her husband Dmitry Stepanovich, she does everything to arrange for her daughters, that is, to marry them off to sufficiently rich and noble suitors. Despite her lack of funds, she keeps an open house, reckoning that the company of beautiful, musically gifted young ladies will attract single men rich enough to marry the dowerless... 

The drama of the love affair between a destitute woman and a rich ship-owner is intensified by the social problem of the woman’s situation in the era of the decline of nobility as a class in the Russian Empire. 

Year of production: 1984

Written and directed by: Eldar Ryazanov 
Director of photography: Vadim Alisov 
Music: Andrey Petrov 
Production designer: Alexander Borisov 
Starring: Larisa Guzeeva, Nikita Mikhalkov, Alisa Freindlich, Andrey Myagkov, Alexey Petrenko, Viktor Proskurin

sources.description:
Yuri Ozerov’s epic historical film series Liberation consists of five pictures.

The first film, The Fire Bulge, tells about the heroic battle at the Kursk Bulge in summer 1943. 

The second film, Breakthrough, is about the battle for the Dnieper River and the Soviet offensive operation in 1944. https://youtu.be/o25BkpllHc0

The third film, Direction of the Main Blow is about Operation Bagration, which resulted in the complete liberation of Belarus from Nazi troops. 
https://youtu.be/5he2R6o-ym0

The fourth film is The Battle of Berlin. 1945, the last months of the war. These are the days when the fate of enslaved Europe is decided. https://youtu.be/-Y-JjqJOd5c

The fifth film, The Last Assault, is about the storming of the Reichstag, about the battle for every room, for every floor...  https://youtu.be/Eb7q6Q_l3Ic

Years of production: 1967—1972

Directed by: Yuri Ozerov
Written by: Yuri Ozerov, Yuri Bondarev, Oskar Kurganov
